reviews.review: Almost perfect movie due to the great story telling and spectacular action sequences.
Just saw this installment and now I can’t wait for Endgame.

This film is, in my honest opinion, the most perfect film I've ever seen. Everything from the action to the effects and characters is all fantastic. And, Thanos is right up there with Darth Vader as one of the greatest villains in the history of cinema

This movie understands how the "Blockbuster genre" of films work as of the time of its release. An admirable orchestration of sheer technical talent that's supported by a well-thought out and planned plot line that subverts expectations whilst also staying predictable enough that one enjoys the film for all its "blockbuster" characteristics.
Entertaining and action-packed, but somewhat predictable and some annoying characters
While waiting for endgame rewatching infinity war is even better as it sets the movie up perfectly.

Now, this is a little hard for me, not because it was a bad movie but the fact that it was a solid movie but has some questions and minor flaws that just won't leave my brain. This film is really big so it's hard to explain what exactly is going on but just to sum it up: this guy Thanos wants to wipe half the population in the universe so people who don't thrive will and instead of going from planet to planet doing it he gets a gauntlet and tries to find six stones that will give him the power to do his plan with a snap of his fingers, and The Avengers have to stop him. Thanos is a great villain, he probably ranks in the top five best in the MCU, I just wanted to point that out. So, a cool premise, but there was so much going on in each scene that your mind won't get a break; it was kind of a small clusterfuck. Since there was just so much shit going on, there were some characters who got enough screen time and some with little. The action was good as usual, with some well-choreographed scenes and visual effects. There were some funny scenes that were actually funny so that was nice, but I never got a heart-warming scene like some movies. Since this is technically a "Part 1" it ends with a cliffhanger that leaves you both anxious and a little confused. I do give the movie credit, there were some parts that made me raise my eyebrows, but disappointingly not jaw-dropping. So, I'm just going to stop it here, this will be too long of if I keep talking about it. Overall, it's a solid entry in the MCU but not without its flaws. I still enjoyed it anyway, I never looked at my watch due to boredom or curiosity. That being said, I'm excited for Avengers 4 and very curious on how they'll end it.
Driven and epic plot with dashes of refreshing comic relief sprinkled throughout. Of course, the Marvel characters were awesome--especially Stark and Strange.
